conclusion: There are four objects above the slabs, which are illuminated by a light source, casting A, B, C and D on the ground.
The light source is currently positioned to the front right of the objects.
Shadow A is cast to the left of the object it corresponds to.
Shadow B is cast to the right of the object it corresponds to.
Shadow C is cast to the left of the object it corresponds to.
Shadow D is cast to the right of the object it corresponds to.
The light source moves to the back left above the objects.

premise: When the light source moves to the back left, the shadows will shift to the opposite side of the objects.
conclusion: Shadow A, which was previously cast to the left, will now be cast to the right.

conclusion: Shadow B, which was previously cast to the right, will now be cast to the right (since it was already on the right side, it will remain on the right but move further to the right).

conclusion: Shadow C, which was previously cast to the left, will now be cast to the right.
